001
002package com.commercetools.docs.meta;
003
004import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ClientBuilder;
005import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.http.ErrorMiddleware;
006
007/**
008 * <h2 id=configuration>Configuration</h2>
009 *
010 * <h3>ApiRoot and ProjectApiRoot</h3>
011 *
012 * <p>The SDK modules provide an ApiRootBuilder to create an {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ApiHttpClient}. To ease the development
013 * the builder can also create a module specific ApiRoot or ProjectApiRoot. E.g.: {@link com.commercetools.api.client.ApiRoot}
014 * and {@link com.commercetools.api.client.ProjectApiRoot}
015 * </p>
016 * <p>Creating http requests starts from the ApiRoot which  holds information specific to the project. The following example
017 * shows how to configure an API root and a project scoped root:</p>
018 *
019 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#instance()}
020 *
021 * <p>Similar configuration to create the root instances for the Import API</p>
022 *
023 * {@include.example example.ImportExamplesTest#instance()}
024 *
025 * <h3>Custom HTTP client</h3>
026 *
027 * <p>The builder can be instantiated with a custom {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.VrapHttpClient} instance. For example a
028 * specific instance of a client</p>
029 *
030 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#customHttpClient()}
031 *
032 * <p>This can also be useful to wrap preconfigured clients e.g. with additional middlewares</p>
033 *
034 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#wrappedClient()}
035 *
036 * <h3>Error handling</h3>
037 *
038 * <p>The client builder adds methods to allow the customization of the error handling</p>
039 *
040 * <h4>Unwrap exceptions</h4>
041 *
042 * <p>By default the {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.http.ErrorMiddleware} is configured to throw a CompletionException. The
043 * {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.ClientBuilder#withErrorMiddleware(ErrorMiddleware.ExceptionMode)} method allows to configure
044 * the middleware to unwrap the causing exception.</p>
045 *
046 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#exceptionMode()}
047 *
048 * <h4>Not found</h4>
049 *
050 * <p>The {@link ErrorMiddleware} throws for every response with a status code 400 or higher an exception. This can be unwanted
051 * behaviour for a {@link io.vrap.rmf.base.client.error.NotFoundException}. The method {@link ClientBuilder#addNotFoundExceptionMiddleware()}
052 * configures the client to return a body with a NULL value instead. The method also allows the filtering of specific request to be
053 * captured.</p>
054 *
055 * {@include.example example.ExamplesTest#notFoundMiddleware()}
056 */
057public class Configuration {
058}
